messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] how hot is it where º    Uº R???
messages.msgSnippet: That s it.  Now I know what I want to be when I grow up!  A weather person. Think about it, they get paid the big bucks (not the guys on the tv but the ones
messages.messageBody:
That's it. Now I know what I want to be when I grow up! A weather person.
Think about it, they get paid the big bucks (not the guys on the tv but
the ones who put the info together for them) and they don't get demoted or
earn anything less if they are wrong more than 50% of the time! Now
there's the ultimate goldbrick job with security cause no one ever expects
them to be really right or on the money with their predictions!

Lynda

----------
> From: Ashling Ranch <Ashling@...>
> To: Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com
> Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] how hot is it where º Uº R???
> Date: Tuesday, September 05, 2000 9:50 AM
>
> Pris,
>
> Weatherbug from Llano said High today was supposed to be 105, but it
was
> revised to 106 last time I checked. However, it is already 108 - and
only
> 11:50 AM - UGH !
> John
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Pris <x_t_sipr@...>
> To: Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com <Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com>
> Date: Tuesday, September 05, 2000 10:57 AM
> Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] how hot is it where º Uº R???
>
>
> >
> >"his train" is uhhhhh the *choo-choo* kind of train ... haha, amusing
only
> >to myself ... dh doesn't like running Amtrac, don't ask me why, prob b/c
> >trains are always LATE and he doesn't like complaints from people ...
his
> >territory is from Taylor/Hearne, TX (above Austin) and down to Laredo
but
> he
> >usually only goes north from SA to Taylor/Hearne and his trains are
freight
> >trains; gravel, cars, tank trucks, etc... AND YES, the tracks are
*usually*
> >is need of repair ... he retires in 8 yrs, so maybe we'll move to CA
after
> >he retires, oops, nope, don't want to be that far from that grandbaby,
> don't
> >you know :} lol ...
> >
> >Pris ~> who'z such a *dreamer* ...
> >WARNING: I cannot be help responsible for the above, as apparently my
cats
> >have learned how to type ...

> >> they are warring with the feds and state about fixing the tracks.
They

> >> have the Amtrac bus route right through town, does he want to drive a
bus
> >> <g>
> >>

> >> > ----- Original Message -----
> >> > From: "Lynda" <lurine@...>
> >> > To: <Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com>
> >> > Sent: Tuesday, September 05, 2000 10:38 AM
> >> > Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] how hot is it where ºUº R???
> >> > >
> >> > > Well, not to make it too terrible for ya, Pris, but we live in an
> area
> >> > that
> >> > > has the average temp for the whole U.S. which means it runs about
67
> >> > > degrees all year. We only vary by about 10 degrees in either
> >direction
> >> > and
> >> > > only have about a dozen frost days a year. The little town "next
> >door"
> >> > has
> >> > > the most growing days in a year for the whole country.
> >> > >
> >> > > However, we can usually drive down the road a bit (half hour to an
> >> hour)
> >> > > and be in some friendly (80 to 90's) heat in one direction and
> serious
> >> > heat
> >> > > (90's and up) in the other. But, this year we didn't get the
> >> "friendly"
> >> > > heat to often on the river which was a disappointment to the
kidlets.
> >> > >
> >> > > And going up the hill to the hotter temps was kinda limited as
last
> >> year
> >> > we
> >> > > lost 100,000 acres to a fire compliments of the parks boozos and
one
> >of
> >> > > their controlled burns.
> >> > >
> >> > > Lynda
